{{Quote|Lord Stark! Torrhen's Square is under siege.|Ser [[Rodrik Cassel]] to Prince [[Bran Stark]]|The Ghost of Harrenhal}}
The '''Raid on Torrhen's Square''' is a battle during the [[War of the Five Kings]]. It is part of a ploy by [[Theon Greyjoy]] - who had abandoned [[House Stark]] and aligned himself with his father [[Balon Greyjoy]], the self-fashioned [[King of the Iron Islands]] - to seize [[Winterfell]] and gain the respect of his father and fellow [[ironborn]].
sections.In the books: In the books, the attack on Torrhen's Square is led personally by [[Dagmer Cleftjaw]]. He is driven away by Ser Rodrik Cassel and men from [[House Cerwyn]] back to the [[Stony Shore]]. After Rodrik returns to [[Winterfell]] in attempt to free it, Dagmer and his men return to Torrhen's Square and take it. Currently they are still there.
sections.History:
===Prelude and battle===
After news of an unidentified party attacking [[Torrhen's Square]] reach Winterfell, Prince [[Bran Stark]] sends [[Rodrik Cassel]] to defend the Stark bannermen of [[House Tallhart]].

===Aftermath===
With Winterfell undefended, Theon leads his crew to Winterfell and [[Fall of Winterfell|seizes it]]. In the meantime, Ser Rodrik is defeated and captured by the ironborn.
